calendar.p: The Julian calendar, as used in England before 1752. The year starts on March 25.

A Hebrew calendar dating from the creation of the world, based on biblical genealogy. The start date varies according to the biblical texts used. Here, based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 3962 BC.
A calendar dating from the Roman discovery of Britain. Based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 50 BC.

body.ab:
Who may haue a Clothe of Estate
and who not.
Duke A Duke may haue a Clothe of Estate in all places
out of the kinges presence so that it come not to the grounde
by halfe a yarde. And no Earle to walke with
hym.
A Dukes eldest sonne is borne a Marques & shall
have asmany poulderinges as a Marques. But
shall goe belowe hym./
A Dukes eldest Daughter is borne a Marchionesse./
A Dukes yonger sonnes are borne Earles. But shall
goe after them./
Marques A Marquesse hathe a Clothe of Estate but it
must hange a yarde from the grounde But in the
Dukes howse or kinges presence he hathe
none.
A Marchionesse may have her gowne birne by a
knightes wife but in the presence of a Dukes wife
by a gentillwoman./
A Marquises eldest sonne is borne an Earle but goeth
after all Earles, And before a Dukes yongest sonne.
His wife goeth beneathe all Countesses & above
all Marquises daughters. but dawghters and
heires.
A Marquises dawghter is borne a Countesse but
shall goes beneathe all Countesses.
Earle An Earle in his howse may have a clothe of Estate
fringed round about without any pendante.
An Earle shall have no Assaies in a Marques=
ses presence but his Cuppe couered.
No Countesse may have her gowne borne in the
Marchionesses presense but by a gentillwoman
but by a Gentillman./
An Earles eldest sonne is borne a Viscounte.
but shall goe beneathe all viscountes.
An Earles yonger sonnes be borne as Barons.
but shall goe belowe all Barons./
Viscount. A Viscount his eldest sonne is borne a Baron
but shall goe belowe all Barons except Earles
yonger sonnes./
